title: How To Train Your Dog To Allow You To Groom Them
summary: The first step in grooming your dog is to brush out all of their fur with a regular touch-up brush. This will help to get out any mats or tangles that have formed in their fur. The next step is to give your dog a thorough bath to make sure they are clean and healthy. After you finish brushing out their fur, you can then use clippers to give them a short cut. You’ll also want to have the right shampoo and conditioner to clean your pet’s fur.

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Dogs are often seen as low-maintenance pets. While this is true in a lot of cases, it\u2019t necessarily the case all the time. Depending on your dog\u2019s breed and their natural instincts, you might find that grooming them can prove to be a very tricky task. If you have struggled to get your dog used to being groomed for some time now, there are several tips and tricks you can use to help train them to allow you to do so.
Dog grooming is something that many pet owners struggle with from time to time, especially if your pet has a specific type of fur that doesn\u2019t grow too much like long hair or curly hair. It\u2019s natural for dogs to dislike having their hair caught in things like bushes or trees while they hunt or run around outside; however, it can also be difficult when trying to keep their hair short and tidy at home.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are the Benefits of Mediation?
What Are the Benefits of Mediation for Couples?
The Top 10 Mostcommon Cat Health Problems
How Mediation Can Help You Resolve Conflicts

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...n}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...n,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a neutral, confidential process that helps parties in conflict reach a mutually beneficial outcome. It is an opportunity for people who are in a dispute to speak directly with one another, explore their differences and find common ground. Mediation is not about winning or losing; it\u2019s about finding peace so everyone can go forward with their lives.
Mediation has been used as an alternative to litigation for more than 2,500 years. The practice of mediation has continued to evolve over time and today there are many different types, including: family mediation, dispute resolution, community mediation, transformative mediation and collaborative law. However, they all have the same core elements and are intended to achieve the same goals: finding common ground between two parties in conflict; preserving personal relationships; and resolving problems constructively by using active listening techniques.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Resolve Conflicts through Mediation

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a process in which an impartial third party helps two people resolve their differences and reach an equitable solution to their conflict. The mediator doesn\u2019t take sides, but instead helps both parties understand each other\u2019s point of view. This way, the disputants can agree on a fair outcome and put an end to their disagreements.
If you are part of an organization that is going through a lot of conflict right now (or any time soon), mediation might be a good solution for reducing tensions, smoothing things over and getting everyone back on track. Here we\u2019ll explain what mediation is, why it works so well for resolving conflicts and how you can initiate it in your organization.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Cutest Kittens in the World

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There are so many different breeds of cats in the world and each one has its own set of unique characteristics. Some cats are more like dogs, while others act more like little lions. They\u2019re all pretty much ADORABLE no matter what type they are. But that isn\u2019t to say that some cats aren\u2019t cuter than others. Some kittens take the cake when it comes to being as sweet and adorable as possible. These top 10 cutest kittens in the world will leave you wanting more.
With a wide range of cat lovers out there, it was almost impossible not to find the best examples of these perfect little furballs available anywhere! Whether you have a soft spot for Persians or tend to lean towards something with a bit more attitude like a Siamese, you\u2019ll find your new favorite kitten here!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are the Benefits of Mediation for Families?

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is an alternative dispute resolution process. It\u2019s a way of resolving disputes that is less adversarial than litigation and usually cheaper, faster, and more private than other methods. Mediation is also collaborative as well as neutral. The mediator acts as a neutral party who helps the parties attempt to resolve their dispute in a fair and equitable manner.
In mediation, both parties together with their respective attorneys choose from various options to settle the case outside of court. The goal of mediation is to find solutions that are agreeable to both parties. It\u2019s about finding win-win solutions instead of win-lose outcomes. It\u2019s about exploring solutions that may not have been considered had the parties not been under the guidance of a mediator who has no stake in either outcome of the dispute other than seeing it resolved amicably and fairly so that everyone walks away feeling like they have gained something from it rather than having given up something they would rather have kept.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Why do crazy cat people love their cats so much? Because their cats are hilarious. With their constant sneering and condescending glares, feline friends have a knack for being entertaining in the most ridiculous ways. So, if you need a break from those stressful final exam cram sessions, we've compiled a list of the top 10 funniest cat videos on YouTube. From silly cats to crafty cats and everything in between, these videos will give you some much-needed LOLs.
Cat videos are one of the most popular video niches online today. There are several channels on YouTube that are dedicated only to cat videos and nothing else. In this post we\u2019ll look at some of the best channels that feature nothing but cat content \u2013 be it funny cat vines or cute cat compilations \u2013 as well as some of our favorite individual clips from these creators.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
